description: President Donald Trump and Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese signed an $8.5 billion critical minerals deal at the White House on October 20, 2025. The agreement aims to boost U.S. access to rare-earth resources as China imposes stricter export controls. Trump called it a game changer, while Albanese said it elevates the alliance. The pact comes ahead of Trump’s meeting with Xi Jinping in South Korea later this month.

Critics argue this dilutes Diwali's Hindu origins and feels dismissive, despite the message wishing joy and peace to all celebrants. The omission overlooks the festival's deep religious and cultural significance for Hindus worldwide.

description: New satellite imagery reveals Iran is rebuilding Taleghan 2, a former nuclear weapons development site at Parchin, following its destruction in an October 2024 Israeli air strike. Construction resumed in May 2025, with a new structure emerging by August. This rebuilding escalates tensions and renews debate over diplomatic efforts to curb Iran's nuclear ambitions.

title: Bihar polls: AIMIM fields non-Muslim candidates; what is Owaisi's strategy?

title: After Daniel's death, Sarin blasts Kramnik - ‘Baseless accusations caused pain’
description: Indian Grandmaster Nihal Sarin has indirectly criticised Vladimir Kramnik following Daniel Naroditsky's death, citing relentless, baseless cheating accusations that caused immense pressure. Naroditsky, who called Kramnik "worse than dirt," experienced severe mental health impacts from the public harassment. The chess world mourns the loss of a bright light whose accessibility to millions was affected by these unfounded allegations.

A protégé of Shinzo Abe, she inherits a complex landscape, focusing on economic stimulus, stronger defense, and assertive diplomacy, particularly concerning China and Taiwan. Her socially conservative and nationalist stance marks a historic milestone amid domestic and global pressures.

title: Items unverified for 40 yrs: Ivory, gold & valuables ‘missing’ from Guruvayur temple; key findings
description: Audits reveal alarming lapses in Guruvayur Devaswom's management of temple valuables, including gold, silver, and ivory. Poor recordkeeping and missing documentation have left precious assets vulnerable to misuse. Despite legal requirements, physical verification of valuables has been neglected for decades, raising concerns about accountability and potential misappropriation.
